title: Ephesians Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Ephesians with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 6 chapters.

questions.question: Who is the author of the Epistle to the Ephesians?
questions.explanation: Paul identifies himself as the author in the opening verse.

questions.question: To whom is the letter of Ephesians addressed?
options: The saints at Ephesus and the faithful in Christ Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: The saints at Ephesus and the faithful in Christ Jesus
questions.explanation: Paul writes to the saints at Ephesus and the faithful in Christ Jesus.

questions.question: What blessing does Paul pronounce at the beginning of Ephesians?
questions.explanation: Paul blesses the readers with grace and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

questions.question: According to Ephesians, believers are chosen in Christ before the foundation of the world to be what?
options: Holy and without blame before Him in love
questions.correctAnswer: Holy and without blame before Him in love
questions.explanation: Believers are chosen to be holy and blameless in love before God.

questions.question: Through whom do believers have redemption and the forgiveness of sins?
questions.explanation: Redemption and forgiveness come through the blood of Christ according to the riches of God's grace.

questions.question: What is the 'earnest of our inheritance' mentioned in Ephesians?
questions.explanation: The Holy Spirit is the guarantee or earnest of our inheritance until the redemption of the purchased possession.

questions.question: What does Paul pray God would give the Ephesians according to Ephesians 1:17?
options: The spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of Him
questions.correctAnswer: The spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of Him
questions.explanation: Paul prays for wisdom and revelation to know God better.

questions.question: Where is Christ seated according to Ephesians 1:20?
options: At the right hand of God in heavenly places
questions.correctAnswer: At the right hand of God in heavenly places
questions.explanation: Christ is raised from the dead and seated at God's right hand in heavenly places.

questions.question: What is the Church described as in Ephesians 1:22-23?
options: The body of Christ, the fullness of Him who fills all in all
questions.correctAnswer: The body of Christ, the fullness of Him who fills all in all
questions.explanation: The church is called Christ’s body and the fullness of Him who fills all in all.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 2:1, what condition were believers in before being made alive?
questions.explanation: Believers were dead in sins before God made them alive with Christ.

questions.question: By what means are believers saved according to Ephesians 2:8?
options: Faith through grace, a gift of God
questions.correctAnswer: Faith through grace, a gift of God
questions.explanation: Salvation is by grace through faith, not by works, so no one can boast.

questions.question: What are believers created unto, according to Ephesians 2:10?
options: Good works which God has prepared beforehand
questions.correctAnswer: Good works which God has prepared beforehand
questions.explanation: Believers are God's workmanship created for good works prepared by God.

questions.question: What did Christ abolish in His flesh according to Ephesians 2:15?
options: The law of commandments contained in ordinances
questions.correctAnswer: The law of commandments contained in ordinances
questions.explanation: Christ abolished the law of commandments in ordinances to create one new man and peace.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 2:19, who are believers now considered to be?
options: Fellowcitizens with the saints and of the household of God
questions.correctAnswer: Fellowcitizens with the saints and of the household of God
questions.explanation: Believers are no longer strangers but fellow citizens and members of God's household.

questions.question: What is the foundation upon which the church is built according to Ephesians 2:20?
options: The prophets and apostles with Jesus Christ as the chief corner stone
questions.correctAnswer: The prophets and apostles with Jesus Christ as the chief corner stone
questions.explanation: The church is built on the foundation of apostles and prophets, with Christ as the chief corner stone.

questions.question: In Ephesians 3:6, what mystery is revealed to Paul regarding the Gentiles?
options: They are fellowheirs and partakers of the promise in Christ by the gospel
questions.correctAnswer: They are fellowheirs and partakers of the promise in Christ by the gospel
questions.explanation: Paul reveals that Gentiles are fellow heirs and partakers in Christ by the gospel.

questions.question: How does Paul describe himself in Ephesians 3:8?
options: Less than the least of all saints
questions.correctAnswer: Less than the least of all saints
questions.explanation: Paul humbly calls himself less than the least of all saints despite his ministry.

questions.question: What does Paul pray that believers may be strengthened with according to Ephesians 3:16?
options: Power through the Spirit in the inner man
questions.correctAnswer: Power through the Spirit in the inner man
questions.explanation: Paul prays for believers to be strengthened with power by the Spirit in their inner being.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 3:17, by what means may Christ dwell in believers' hearts?
questions.explanation: Christ dwells in believers' hearts through faith.

questions.question: What is the love of Christ described as in Ephesians 3:19?
questions.explanation: The love of Christ surpasses knowledge and fills believers with the fullness of God.

questions.question: Who ascended far above all heavens to fill all things according to Ephesians 4:10?
questions.explanation: Christ descended and ascended far above all heavens to fill all things.

questions.question: What gifts did Christ give to men according to Ephesians 4:11?
options: Apostles, prophets, evangelists, pastors, and teachers
questions.correctAnswer: Apostles, prophets, evangelists, pastors, and teachers
questions.explanation: Christ gave these specific gifts to equip the saints for ministry.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the gifts given by Christ according to Ephesians 4:12?
options: For the perfecting of the saints, the work of the ministry, and edifying the body of Christ
questions.correctAnswer: For the perfecting of the saints, the work of the ministry, and edifying the body of Christ
questions.explanation: The gifts are for equipping believers to build up the church.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 4:13, what is the goal for the church?
options: To come to unity of the faith and knowledge of the Son of God, to a perfect man
questions.correctAnswer: To come to unity of the faith and knowledge of the Son of God, to a perfect man
questions.explanation: The goal is spiritual maturity and unity in Christ.

questions.question: What does Paul say believers should put off and put on according to Ephesians 4:22-24?
options: Put off faith, put on works
Put off the old man, put on the new man created in righteousness and holiness
Put off love, put on hate
Put off prayer, put on fasting
questions.correctAnswer: Put off the old man, put on the new man created in righteousness and holiness
questions.explanation: Believers must discard their old sinful nature and adopt a new holy nature.

questions.question: What commandment with promise is quoted in Ephesians 6 regarding children obeying their parents?
questions.explanation: It is the first commandment with promise that it may be well with thee.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 6:4, how should fathers treat their children?
options: Bring them up in the nurture and admonition of the Lord
questions.correctAnswer: Bring them up in the nurture and admonition of the Lord
questions.explanation: Fathers should nurture and admonish children in the Lord and not provoke them to anger.

questions.question: What instruction does Paul give to servants in Ephesians 6:5?
options: Obey your masters with fear and trembling, as unto Christ
questions.correctAnswer: Obey your masters with fear and trembling, as unto Christ
questions.explanation: Servants are to obey masters sincerely as serving Christ.

questions.question: How should masters treat their servants according to Ephesians 6:9?
options: Without threatening, knowing God is no respecter of persons
questions.correctAnswer: Without threatening, knowing God is no respecter of persons
questions.explanation: Masters should treat servants well, fearing God who shows no partiality.

questions.question: What spiritual armor does Paul mention first in Ephesians 6:14?
questions.explanation: Paul instructs to stand with the breastplate of righteousness first.

questions.question: What is described as the 'sword of the Spirit' in Ephesians 6?
questions.explanation: The word of God is the sword of the Spirit.

questions.question: What is Paul’s final exhortation regarding prayer in the armor of God passage?
options: Pray always with all prayer and supplication in the Spirit
questions.correctAnswer: Pray always with all prayer and supplication in the Spirit
questions.explanation: Paul urges constant prayer and vigilance in the Spirit.

questions.question: True or False: Ephesians teaches that salvation is by works of the law.
questions.explanation: Salvation is by grace through faith, not by works of the law.

questions.question: True or False: Christ abolished the enmity between Jews and Gentiles by the cross.
questions.explanation: Christ reconciled both groups into one new man through the cross.

questions.question: True or False: Paul considers himself the greatest of all saints.
questions.explanation: Paul humbly calls himself less than the least of all saints.

questions.question: True or False: The church is described as the body of Christ in Ephesians.
questions.explanation: The church is the body of Christ, the fullness of Him.

questions.question: True or False: Paul instructs believers to be angry and sin in Ephesians.
questions.explanation: Paul says be angry but sin not and do not give place to the devil.

questions.question: True or False: Believers are urged to put on the new man created after God in righteousness and true holiness.
questions.explanation: Paul instructs believers to put on the new man created in holiness.

questions.question: True or False: The 'helmet of salvation' is part of the armor of God described in Ephesians 6.
questions.explanation: The helmet of salvation is one piece of the spiritual armor Paul describes.

questions.question: True or False: Paul tells servants to obey their masters only when they watch them.
questions.explanation: Servants should obey not with eye-service but sincerely as to Christ.

questions.question: True or False: The peace of God guards believers’ hearts and minds in Christ Jesus.
questions.explanation: Paul teaches that the peace of God will guard hearts and minds.

questions.question: True or False: Paul encourages believers to speak every man truth with his neighbor.
questions.explanation: Paul instructs believers to put away lying and speak truth one to another.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'For by grace are ye saved through _____; and that not of yourselves: it is the gift of God:'
questions.explanation: Salvation is by grace through faith, not by works.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'That Christ may dwell in your hearts by _____; that ye, being rooted and grounded in love,'
questions.explanation: Christ dwells in hearts by faith.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'And be ye kind one to another, tenderhearted, _____ one another, even as God for Christ's sake hath forgiven you.'
questions.explanation: Believers are to forgive one another as God forgave through Christ.
